items.title: Trump announces NATO deal to expand US military access to Greenland

featured_image.name: Trump's Greenland grab is part of a new space race – and the stakes are getting higher

items.description:
President Donald Trump announced a "framework" deal with NATO on Wednesday to expand US military access to Greenland, doubling down on his view that the Arctic island is essential to American space defense capabilities while backing off threats to use force in acquiring the territory.

Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, Trump characterized Greenland as "strategically vital" to US interests and emphasized its role in the American military's Space Force operations. "We're going to have the military we want," he told Fox Business following the announcement.[1][2]

items.title: Trump calls for 'immediate negotiations' to acquire Greenland

featured_image.name: Trump digs in on Greenland threats during Davos speech

items.description:
In a hypothetical nuclear exchange involving the United States, Russia, and China, the vast Arctic territory of Greenland would sit directly in the crossfire. Its location—beneath the flight paths that intercontinental ballistic missiles would traverse between these nuclear powers—has made the semi-autonomous Danish territory a focal point of President Donald Trump's aggressive push to acquire it for his ambitious "Golden Dome" missile defense initiative.

Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on January 21, Trump called for "immediate negotiations" to acquire Greenland, describing it as "this land on which we're going to build the greatest golden dome ever built." He added: "If there is a war, much of the action will take place on that piece of ice. Think of it: those missiles would be flying right over the centre."[1][2]

items.title: Dingoes 'not likely' to have caused Canadian teen's death, autopsy reveals
items.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds dingo bites are not likely to have caused the death of Piper James on K'gari.

items.title: EU ready to implement Mercosur deal provisionally, von der Leyen says

featured_image.name: EU and Mercosur reach political agreement on groundbreaking ...

items.description:
The European Parliament voted on Wednesday to refer the EU-Mercosur trade agreement to the European Court of Justice, dealing a blow to the bloc's largest trade pact just days after its signing ceremony in Paraguay and sparking a standoff with the European Commission over provisional implementation.

The narrow vote—334 in favor, 324 against, with 11 abstentions—suspends the ratification process and could delay the deal by up to two years while judges in Luxembourg assess whether the agreement is compatible with EU treaties.[1][2][3]

items.title: Greenland PM says he was not consulted on Trump-NATO deal

featured_image.name: Q+A | Greenland's PM takes questions on Trump, sovereignty ... - CBC

items.description:
The world's largest island has found itself at the intersection of climate science and geopolitical rivalry as NATO allies scramble to respond to U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed push to gain control of Greenland, even as new research underscores the territory's irreplaceable role in understanding global warming.

At the World Economic Forum in Davos on Wednesday, Trump announced a "framework for a future deal" regarding Greenland after meeting with NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte, stepping back from earlier threats of military force or punitive tariffs against European nations opposing his acquisition efforts. Yet the specifics of this arrangement remain unclear to its most important stakeholder: Greenland itself.[1][2]

items.title: Bank of Japan holds rates steady, boosting Asian and US markets
items.description:
The Bank of Japan kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 0.75% on Friday, as expected, while raising its economic growth and inflation forecasts. The decision provided a stabilizing force for markets still recovering from a historic bond selloff earlier in the week triggered by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's snap election announcement.

Asian equities edged higher following the decision, with Japan's Nikkei 225 rising 0.2% to 53,800.28. U.S. futures also gained modestly, with S&P 500 futures up 0.2%. South Korea's Kospi climbed 0.6%, trading just below the 5,000 milestone it crossed for the first time on Thursday.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Lawyers request AFP probe into Israeli president as Australian visit looms
items.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

items.title: US control of Venezuela oil threatens China's debt repayment

featured_image.name: Supertankers sailing to pick up Venezuelan oil for China make U-turn

items.description:
The United States' takeover of Venezuela's oil exports has ensnared crude shipments that were servicing debt to China, setting the stage for a potential showdown between the two superpowers that could further complicate the South American nation's path out of default.

Around a tenth of Venezuela's $150 billion foreign debt pile is estimated to be loans from China that the OPEC member was paying in oil cargoes — until the US seized Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro earlier this month. The Trump administration has announced that proceeds from Venezuelan oil sales will be directed to a Qatar-based account under Washington's control, potentially giving the US president substantial leverage over which creditors get paid and when.[1][2][3]

items.title: New passport rules designed to improve national security, UK government says
items.description: The requirement for dual British citizens to have a valid UK passport while entering the country would help prevent the arrival of people who present a threat, Australia's British High Commission says.

items.title: Gold nears $5,000 record as Trump announces naval fleet heading to Iran

featured_image.name: Gold breaks new record on Greenland tariff threats — $7,000 level on the cards

items.description:
Gold surged to an unprecedented high just shy of $5,000 an ounce on Friday, as escalating geopolitical tensions and a weakening dollar propelled the precious metal toward a historic milestone. Spot gold rose to a record $4,967.48 per ounce, marking a nearly 15% gain since the start of 2026 and extending a rally that saw the metal climb roughly 64% last year.[1][2][3]

The rally gained fresh momentum after President Donald Trump announced that a "massive" U.S. naval force is heading toward Iran, reigniting Middle East tensions that had briefly cooled following his retreat from Greenland tariff threats. "We have an armada. We have a massive fleet heading in that direction, and maybe we won't have to use it," Trump told reporters aboard Air Force One returning from the World Economic Forum in Davos.[4][5][6]

items.title: 'It's a quiet town': Neighbours in shock after triple fatal shooting
items.description: Residents of a remote NSW town of just 1,500 residents have expressed shock at a deadly shooting spree where three people were shot dead.

items.title: Trump revokes Canada's invitation to Board of Peace

featured_image.name: Trump Launches ‘Board of Peace’ in Davos

items.description:
U.S. President Donald Trump withdrew Canada's invitation to join his Board of Peace initiative on Thursday, marking an escalation in the diplomatic clash between Washington and Ottawa following Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's critique of American dominance at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

In a message posted on Truth Social, Trump addressed Carney directly: "Please let this Letter serve to represent that the Board of Peace is withdrawing its invitation to you regarding Canada's joining, what will be the most prestigious Board of Leaders ever assembled, at any time."[1][2][3]

items.title: How landslides happen, the warning signs and where they're most common
items.description: Two people have died after a landslide hit their home in New Zealand and authorities are searching for several others feared dead in another slip nearby. Here's how landslides occur, the warning signs and where they are most common.

items.title: Track temperatures live as heatwave sweeps continent
items.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

items.title: China launches high-efficiency lithium extraction facility

featured_image.name: China expanding lithium facility at Qinghai Salt Lake

items.description: Researchers in the United States and China have announced advances in lithium extraction technology that could address supply chain bottlenecks for electric vehicle batteries and renewable energy storage systems. The developments, revealed within days of each other, promise faster and cleaner methods for recovering lithium from brine sources that traditional techniques struggle to exploit.

items.title: US seeks to eliminate all restrictions on Greenland military access

featured_image.name: Trump's Greenland Demand: Unlimited US Military Presence ...

items.description:
The United States is pushing to rewrite its seven-decade-old defense agreement with Denmark to remove all restrictions on its military presence in Greenland, according to people familiar with the negotiations, as American negotiators seek to satisfy President Donald Trump's demands for control over the strategic Arctic territory.

The original 1951 agreement, which was amended in 2004, requires the US to "consult with and inform" Denmark and Greenland before making "any significant changes to United States military operations or facilities in Greenland." American negotiators now want to eliminate this language entirely to ensure the US faces no restrictions in its military planning, according to sources who spoke to Bloomberg on condition of anonymity.[1][2]

items.title: These maps show why the US is obsessed with Greenland and its Arctic neighbours
items.description: After a week of escalating rhetoric over Greenland, Donald Trump says he has now secured "total access" to the Arctic island. This is why that region is so important.

items.title: Live: De Minaur powers through with straight-sets win over Tiafoe
items.description: Alex de Minaur defeats American Frances Tiafoe in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena after Yulia Putintseva mocks Turkish fans after knocking out qualifier Zeynep Sönmez. Follow live.

items.title: Defiant Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' exit, vows to remain leader
items.description: The Liberal leader did not speak about the Nationals' decision to terminate the Coalition on yesterday's National Day of Mourning, but on Friday insisted her focus was on the government.

items.title: Gunman wanted over triple shooting could be difficult to find, police say
items.description: Police have warned residents in villages neighbouring Lake Cargelligo to remain vigilant after three people were shot dead in a domestic violence attack on Thursday.

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
